page.title: 19PROVOST OF CUMBERNAULD
page.content: {Provost, }is the name used in Scotland for the chairman of the{District {Council. }He is first of all{elected {by the people }as a councillor then the councillors of the ruling party elect a leader who becomes known as the Provost. The position is held at present by{Provost James Pollock}who was elected in 1984 and will serve until 1988. It is a very difficult role since he has a full time job as well as being Provost. He has to divide his time during the day equally between being provost and his own job although most of his evenings and weekends are taken up by his duties as Provost. These duties vary from{chairing council {meetings }and{hosting civic receptions for visitors to the town to{attending {many community events }such as gala days, sports events etc.
